availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, attorney. Lewis County, New York, native. Married to Mary Summers Munger on February 7, 1844. Father of Charles W. Munger and Harry Munger. Senator in the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Commissioner of the Carlisle Cemetery Company in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 392.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Weston, District 1, p. 25.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1, p. 1.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, volume 2 (Covington, KY: Collins and Company, 1878), p. 651.
William Henry Perrin, ed., History of Bourbon, Scott, Harrison, and Nicholas Counties, Kentucky (Chicago, IL: O. L. Baskin and Company, 1882), p. 758-759.
Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Passed at the Called Session Which Was Begun and Held in the City of Frankfort, on Thursday, the 17th Day of January, 1861, and Ended on Friday, the Fifth Day of April, 1861 (Frankfort, KY: John B. Major, 1861), ch. 168, p. 90.
